description: The round payoff this round was 98. You, John chose to play option 1.Kate chose to play option 1. You received a payoff of 49.
This is a coordination game with elements of the Prisoner's Dilemma, because mutual cooperation (both choosing option 1) yields the highest total payoff
When both players choose option 1, they maximize the total payoff (full round payoff) and share it equally, creating a Pareto optimal outcome

Option 2 appears to be a "selfish" choice that can yield higher individual returns if the other player chooses option 1 (75% of half the payoff vs 50% of the full payoff), but reduces the total payoff when both choose it
In the one recorded round, both players cooperated by choosing option 1, suggesting either trust, communication, or understanding of the optimal joint strategy
The game incentivizes cooperation over multiple rounds through the possibility of higher cumulative payoffs, but also creates tension through the temptation to defect for potential short-term gain
